Polynomial¶

Summary¶

class TheoryBasic.TheoryPolynomial[source]¶

Fit a polynomial of degree \(n\) to the data

  • Function
    \[y(x) = \sum_{i=0}^n A_i x^i\]
  • Parameters

    • \(n\): degree of the polynomial function.

    • \(A_i\): polynomial coefficeints.

Power Law¶

Summary¶

class TheoryBasic.TheoryPowerLaw[source]¶

Fit a power law to the data

  • Function
    \[y(x) = a x^b\]
  • Parameters

    • \(a\): prefactor.

    • \(b\): exponent.

Exponential¶

Summary¶

class TheoryBasic.TheoryExponential[source]¶

Fit a single exponential decay to the data

  • Function
    \[y(x) = a \exp(-x/T)\]
  • Parameters

    • \(a\): prefactor.

    • \(T\): exponential “time” constant.

Double Exponential¶

Summary¶

class TheoryBasic.TheoryTwoExponentials[source]¶

Fit two single exponential decay to the data

  • Function
    \[y(x) = a_1 \exp(x/T_1) + a_2 \exp(-x/T_2)\]
  • Parameters

    • \(a_1\), \(a_2\): prefactors.

    • \(T_1\), \(T_2\): exponential “time” constants.
